content.description: Climb up into the overhanging flake, then head up and right.  After 3 or 4 bolts, head left to a cool finger crack.  Climb up right beneath the large dihedral roof crack with a dead tree in it.  Here, traverse right to another dihedral crack.  Climb it up to the anchors on the left.  Good rock up high.  Pretty good rock in the overhanging flake.
content.protection: Bolts, slings, gear to 2".  2-bolt anchor.  Rap.
content.location: At the left end of the Crescent Wall, this route starts below a right-arching overhanging layback flake.

content.description: TR might be the best option since the bolts and gear placement can be a bit sketchy in spots

5 bolts lead you out the ceiling of the cave via the obviously line of pockets to the crux just below the craziest mantel at Trappers.   Has fixed draws minus the fifth bolt, anchors have rap rings.  Great place to escape the heat...
content.protection: 4 fixed draws, 1 draw needed for the fifth bolt
content.location: Up the gully north of “Morning Wood”

content.description: Follow Ultra Pimp all the way up to the traverse under the large dihedral roof crack with the dead tree in it.  Instead of traversing, climb this crack.  Be careful not to pull on the tree or it may come out.
content.protection: Bolts, gear to 2.5 inches.  2-bolt anchor.  Rap.

content.description: Climb the slabby crack to the vertical dihedral halfway up, the highlight of the climb.  Continue around the right side of the chossy buttress on the left.  Decent rock.
content.protection: Pro to 2".  Rap off of tree.
content.location: In the middle of the Crescent Wall area, just right of Fish and Bits.  Aim for the dihedral up higher.

content.description: Climb up and left, following bolts and pulling some bulges along the way.  Near the top, head into the right dihedral crack or traverse left into Ultra Pimp for a less 'heady' finish.  Decent rock.
content.protection: Bolts, gear to 2".  2-bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: On the Crescent Wall, 20-30 feet right of Ultra Pimp.

content.description: Climb the featured slab, maybe getting in occasional pro.  Decent rock.
content.protection: Sparse gear to 1".  Bolted anchors, though they may be suspect.  Rap.
content.location: On the right end of the Crescent Wall area, between Fish and Bits and the walkdown.  Begin under the low-angled slab with many scoops and pockets.

content.description: Fish and Bits has been retrobolted into a full sport line. No more mid anchor either. Scramble up the intro slab through large pockets to the first bolt. From here moderate slab climbing on low angle terrain leads you up under the roof with a finger crack running through it, clipping bolts along the way. Pull the roof on good holds and cruise to the anchor.
content.location: Climbers left of the walk down. Second route right of the cave. Right of Archimedes (10a).

content.description: Scramble up the easy, run out slab on large huecos and scoops positioning under the second bolt. The crux sequence ends at the fourth bolt. Fire past the second bolt to a series of about 6-7 moves that lands you at a quick clip at the third bolt. Hold it together and work small feet and a lock-off to another reachy face section providing a good rest jug at the fourth bolt. Switch gears on the remaining half of the route on semi-sustained 11- slab that will keep your attention all the way to the top.
content.protection: 7 Bolts. Fixed steel lower off anchor.
content.location: First bolt line left of the cave by Fish and Bits. Between Astro Boy and Archimedes. This is the first wall left of the walk-down.

content.description: Gingerly scramble up the opening slab on pockets and broken face holds to a stance below the second bolt. Bust a sequence of crimps to a side-pull crux at the fourth bolt. Trend past a couple of features and over a tiny overhang, mostly sustained, all the way to the top of the slab.
content.protection: 8 bolts. Fixed steel lower off anchor.
content.location: This route is located left of Archimedes on the face left of the cave. Scramble up the slab to a rocky belay perch behind a down tree.

content.description: This route is named after an owl that presides in a small cave high above the water on this wall. He would fly out every morning when I arrived to work on the line. A few interesting pockets and juggy crimps get you onto the slab proper. Climb through good rock, past deep slopey ripples until a blank section on high feet. Figure it out, then, climb up under the roof and pull on decent holds and finish on the upper slab. A 35 meter rope barely reaches when belaying in the alcove.
content.protection: 7 Bolts. Fixed steel lower off anchor.
content.location: This route is to the left of Fish and Bits. Starting in a slabby alcove to the right of the cave.

content.description: A slabby wall and vertical buttress make up this area.  Mostly good rock, but some bad sections.
